alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 5:08AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHEAST GEORGIA... Modest rainfall totals were observed in the northeast Georgia mountains overnight, but locations from Toccoa southeast through Elberton were generally dry. This permitted brush and other surface fuels to continue to dry out. In addition, gusty winds will develop behind a cold front passing through the region today. Several hours of westerly wind gusts in excess of 25 mph are likely and these breezy conditions will combine with the dry fuels to increase fire danger across much of northeast Georgia. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities on whether you can burn today. If you do burn, use extreme caution since fires can quickly get out of hand under these conditions.
